trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The brineclaw warlock can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brineblooded
entries: The brineclaw warlock has resistance to cold and poison damage.

trait.name: Tidecaller's Pact
entries: The warlock has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Barnacle Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Abyssal Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The warlock targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Slippery Escape {@recharge 4}
entries: The warlock teleports up to 30 feet to a space it can see that is submerged in water or adjacent to a water source.

reaction.name: Rebuke the Tides
entries: When the warlock is damaged by a melee attack, it can force the attacker to make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

Brineclaw Warlocks drown their past names and memories in the deep, surfacing only to channel the will of ancient abyssal powers. In battle, their words churn water to ice, and their curses sink hope like a stone through black tides.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The brineclaw warblade can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The brineclaw warblade has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the brineclaw warblade's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The brineclaw warblade has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warblade makes three attacks: two with its Wavecleaver Blade and one with its Claw.

action.name: Wavecleaver Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Riptide Smash {@recharge 5}
entries: The warblade slams its blade into the ground or deck, releasing a pressurized burst of water in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Surging Assault {@recharge 4}
entries: The warblade moves up to its swim speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one wavecleaver blade attack at the end of that movement.

Brineclaw Warblades are the spear-tips of tidebound warbands, their barbed swords forged from wreck-shard steel and shark-tooth inlay. They strike first and hardest, using undercurrents of water pressure to batter decks and drag foes screaming into the surf.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The abyssal fangspinner can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The abyssal fangspinner ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Carapace Rebound
entries: When the fangspinner is hit by a ranged weapon attack, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6 the projectile ricochets harmlessly off its chitinous plates and the attack misses instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fangspinner makes two Venomous Bite attacks and one Silken Cast attack.

action.name: Venemous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Silken Cast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by sticky webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, escaping on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 15; vulnerability to fire).

action.name: Abyssal Rend {@recharge 5}
entries: The fangspinner rakes the ground in a 15-foot cone with serrated fore-limbs. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Skittering Pounce
entries: The fangspinner moves up to half its speed. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of a creature it can see, it may make one Venomous Bite attack against that creature.

Abyssal Fangspinners lurk where the boundaries of worlds are thinnest, spinning lattices of poisoned silk across hell-scoured chasms. They hunt not for hunger but for malice, savoring the slow dissolution of prey wrapped tight beneath their barbed limbs.

trait.name: Burrowing Colossus
entries: The leviathan ignores difficult terrain while burrowing and doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it emerges from the ground.

trait.name: Psychic Scree
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the leviathan that attempt to concentrate on a spell have disadvantage on their Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

trait.name: Gullet of Nightmares
entries: The leviathan can have up to one Large or two Medium or smaller creatures swallowed at a time. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and effects outside the leviathan, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the leviathan's turns. If the leviathan takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the leviathan.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leviathan makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed.

action.name: Mind-Rip Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The leviathan exhales a 60-foot cone of psionic static. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The overlord can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Apex Frenzy
entries: The overlord has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that is missing any of its hit points.

trait.name: Commander of the Deep
entries: Allies of the overlord that can see or hear it have advantage on their first attack roll each round while they are within 30 feet of the overlord.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The overlord makes three attacks: one with its {@action Trident} and two with its {@action Claw|Brineclaw Overlord|brineclaw overlord|claw}.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+7} piercing damage, or {@damage 1d10+7} piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+6} slashing damage.

action.name: Tidal Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The overlord unleashes a fearsome bellow. Each creature of the overlord’s choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Harpoon Leap
entries: The overlord moves up to half its swim speed without provoking opportunity attacks and may make one claw attack at the end of that movement.

Brineclaw Overlords rule submerged fiefdoms where broken masts and bleached bones form coral-throne halls. They measure wealth in prisoners and storm-gathered tribute, leading tidal warbands to claim the surface world for the crashing dark below.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The reaver can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brine Frenzy
entries: The reaver has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that is missing any of its hit points.

trait.name: Pack Fury
entries: The reaver has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one ally of the reaver is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reaver makes two attacks: one with its {@action Spear} and one with its {@action Claw|Brineclaw Reaver|brineclaw reaver|claw}.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+1} piercing damage, or {@damage 1d8+1} piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d4+1} slashing damage.

Brineclaw Reavers patrol tidal caverns and sunken trade routes, bursting onto lonely decks in a surge of claws and salt-slick spears. They fight like reef-born piranhas—testing for weakness, surrounding the wounded, and dragging victims below to the lightless halls they call home.

trait.name: Aberrant Aegis
entries: The cerebrant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical or psionic effects.

trait.name: Mindsight
entries: The cerebrant always knows the location of any creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or higher within 60 feet of it, even if the creature is invisible or hidden.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cerebrant makes two {@action Neural Lash} attacks.

action.name: Neural Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 3d6+4} psychic damage, and the target can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Cerebral Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 4d6+4} psychic damage. If the target is concentrating on a spell, it makes the ensuing Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration with disadvantage.

action.name: Synaptic Detonation {@recharge 5}
entries: The cerebrant unleashes psionic feedback in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails the save is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Dominating Pulse {@recharge 6}
entries: The cerebrant targets one creature within 30 ft. that is stunned or charmed by it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the {@spell dominate person} spell (no concentration) for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Psychic Backlash
entries: When a creature the cerebrant can see within 30 ft. hits it with an attack, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage.

Cerebrants are living fonts of psionic energy, feared by mind and mage alike. They shepherd lesser intellects with psychic leashes, unraveling enemy thoughts and scattering memories with a pulse of neural agony.

spellcasting.name: Innate Psionics
headerEntries: The cerebrant’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately manifest the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Dream-Forged Discipline
entries: The bladesworn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The bladesworn’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bladesworn makes two {@action Dreamsteel Blade} attacks.

action.name: Dreamsteel Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+4} slashing damage plus {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The bladesworn releases a wave of telepathic force in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Dreamstep {@recharge 4}
entries: The bladesworn teleports up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The bladesworn adds +3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the bladesworn must see the attacker and be wielding its Dreamsteel Blade.

Chimerite Bladesworn roam the astral seams of the Dreamtide, mercenary guardians hired to escort caravans of memory or to duel would-be plane-raiders. Each sword is hammered from crystallised dreams—light as thought, sharp as revelation—and the warriors’ disciplined minds let them blink between heartbeats, leaving only a shimmer of after-image where steel met shadow.

monster.name: Cinderflame Vestige
languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can’t speak

trait.name: Blazing Visage
entries: The vestige sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 ft.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vestige has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The vestige’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Fiery Ray
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d6} fire damage.

action.name: Incinerating Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The vestige explodes with searing flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the vestige must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

When a powerful mage dies consumed by rage—and by flame—their skull may ignite again with hateful purpose. A Cinderflame Vestige drifts through ruins and battlefields like a vengeful lantern, incinerating the living in imitation of the pyre that birthed it.

trait.name: Dream Logic
entries: If a creature looks into a mirror while adjacent to the Doppelmask, it sees the Doppelmask mimicking its movements just before it performs them. The Doppelmask gains advantage on its next attack against that creature.

action.name: Clawing Imitation
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+3} slashing damage. If the target is being mirrored, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.

action.name: Unsettling Echo {@recharge 5}
entries: The Doppelmask unleashes a shriek in the mirrored voice of a creature it is imitating. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and be unable to speak or cast spells with verbal components until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Steal Face (1/day)
entries: The Doppelmask targets a creature within 5 feet that it is currently mirroring. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be silenced for 1 minute as their reflection detaches and replaces the Doppelmask’s form. While silenced, the creature cannot speak, and its reflection no longer matches its actions. The Doppelmask gains temporary hit points equal to half the target’s level (minimum 5). The target may repeat the save at the end of each of its turns.

bonus.name: Reflective Form
entries: As a bonus action, the Doppelmask may choose one creature it can see. It assumes that creature’s appearance and mimics their posture and voice. While mirroring a creature, it has advantage on Deception and Insight checks against them, and the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the Doppelmask’s abilities. This effect lasts until the Doppelmask chooses a new target or is incapacitated.

monster.name: Dream-Eaten Husk
languages: understands languages it knew in life but can’t speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The husk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.

trait.name: Nightmare Aura
entries: At the start of each of the husk’s turns, each creature within 10 ft. that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn; on a success, the creature takes half damage and isn’t frightened.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+3} necrotic damage.

action.name: Haunting Visage {@recharge 5}
entries: The husk chooses one creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d8+4} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 1d10} psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Lance {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem launches a lance of psychic energy at one creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage, or half as much on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Duskslip
entries: While the hound is in dim light or darkness, it is {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on darkvision to see it.

trait.name: Light Aversion
entries: While in bright light, the hound has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+3} piercing damage plus {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

action.name: Gloom-Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The hound releases a chilling howl audible within 300 feet. Each creature of the hound’s choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to that hound’s Gloom-Howl for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Radiant Halo
entries: The beastkin sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for another 30 feet. The first time on a turn that a hostile creature enters or starts its turn in the bright light, it takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The beastkin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The beastkin’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beastkin makes two {@action Hoof} attacks.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d8+6} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The beastkin exhales brilliant light in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
{@bold Detect.} The beastkin makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.
{@bold Hoof.} The beastkin makes one {@action Hoof} attack.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the filthfiend must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all filthfiends’ Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Death Slop
entries: When the filthfiend drops to 0 hit points, it bursts in a spray of noxious sludge. Each creature within 5 feet must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4+1} slashing damage plus {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

Filthfiends ooze up from the lowest cess-chambers of the Nightmarsh, embodying rot, refuse, and eternal spite. Though individually weak, they swarm in reeking packs that overwhelm foes by sheer noisome persistence.

trait.name: Pack Hunter
entries: The raider has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one ally of the raider is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Frenzied Pursuit
entries: When the raider reduces a creature to 0 hit points on its turn, it can move up to half its speed and make one {@action Bite} attack as part of the same action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The raider makes two attacks: one with its {@action Scythe-Axe} and one with its {@action Bite} (or one with its {@action Javelin} if wielding that weapon).

action.name: Scythe-Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d10+4} slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+3} piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d4+3} piercing damage.

bonus.name: Blood-Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The raider unleashes a guttural howl. Each non-gnarlfang creature of the raider’s choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the raider’s next turn. Allies that can hear the howl gain advantage on their next attack roll made before the start of the raider’s next turn.

Gnarlfang Raiders sweep down from wind-scoured badlands, eyes wild with hunger and crude scythe-axes raised high. They fight in loose packs, driving terrified settlers toward ambush sites where lean jaws snap shut on any who stumble.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The siphoner can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bog Camouflage
entries: The siphoner has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while it is submerged in muddy water or prone in swampy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 2d6+2} piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the siphoner can’t bite another target.

action.name: Blood Siphon
entries: The siphoner drains vital fluids from one creature it is grappling. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and the siphoner regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. If this reduces the target to 0 hit points, the siphoner releases the corpse and may move up to half its swim speed as part of this action.

Mire-drain Siphoners burrow beneath silted riverbeds, sensing heartbeats through waterlogged earth. When warm blood ripples the mire, these bloated horrors erupt, latching on with rasping jaws until only a pale husk remains floating in the reeds.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The jester has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Aura of Despair
entries: At the start of each of its turns, each creature of the jester’s choice within 10 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jester makes two {@action Rapier} attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+4} piercing damage.

action.name: Laughing Gas {@recharge 5}
entries: The jester exhales a cloud of hysterical laughter in a 15-ft. cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} with laughter for 1 minute. Affected creatures can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
{@bold Blade Flourish.} The jester makes one {@action Rapier} attack.
{@bold Mocking Jest.} One creature the jester can see within 60 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
{@bold Tumble.} The jester moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Panoptic Awareness
entries: The tyrant can’t be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: All-Around Vision
entries: Creatures don’t gain advantage on attack rolls against the tyrant as a result of being unseen by it.

trait.name: Gravity Drift
entries: The tyrant hovers and can’t be knocked prone.

trait.name: Optic Beams
entries: When the tyrant fires a beam, roll a d8 to determine which one (spell save DC 17):

items.name: 1. Gravitic Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 6d8} force damage and be pulled up to 30 feet. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pulled.

items.name: 2. Brainfire Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't stunned.

items.name: 3. Paralyzing Gleam
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4. Prismatic Shred
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 10d8} radiant damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage.

items.name: 5. Frightful Spectrum
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 6. Petrifying Glare
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

items.name: 7. Somnolent Lumen
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} psychic damage and fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

items.name: 8. Warp Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be teleported up to 60 feet to a spot the tyrant can see and take {@damage 6d8} force damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't teleported.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tyrant unleashes three Optic Beams at random targets it can see within 120 feet, choosing each beam’s target independently.
{@bold Detect.} The tyrant makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.
{@bold Drift.} The tyrant moves up to half its flying speed.
{@bold Optic Salvo (Costs 2 Actions).} The tyrant fires one random Optic Beam.

An Oculord Tyrant’s many facets drink starlight, converting it into kaleidoscopic death. These solitary despots cultivate pockets of reality as personal laboratories, abducting thinkers and heroes to dissect their memories—and occasionally their bodies—in pursuit of ever-greater dominion over the void.

trait.name: Halo of Dawn
entries: The vanguard sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for another 20 feet. Magical darkness can’t extinguish this light.

trait.name: Holy Stride
entries: The vanguard’s movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and opportunity attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vanguard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vanguard makes two {@action Sunblade} attacks.

action.name: Sunblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+7} slashing damage plus {@damage 3d8} radiant damage.

action.name: Solar Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d8} radiant damage. The javelin is a lance of solid light and disappears after it hits or misses.

action.name: Supernal Flare {@recharge 5}
entries: The vanguard unleashes a burst of searing brilliance in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature of the vanguard’s choice in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is also {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Blazing Step {@recharge 4}
entries: The vanguard teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, leaving a trail of lingering light. Each enemy that the vanguard passes within 5 feet of during this teleportation takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

reaction.name: Aegis of Morning
entries: When the vanguard or a creature it can see within 30 feet would take radiant or necrotic damage, the vanguard halves that damage.

Radiant Vanguards stride the planes as living beacons, answering unspoken prayers at the moment night seems poised to triumph. Their swords hum with dawn’s promise, and their shields blaze with the certainty that every darkness can be kindled into day.

monster.name: Restless Avenger
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Undying Grudge
entries: When the avenger rises, it irrevocably chooses one creature it blames for its death, called its nemesis. The avenger always knows the direction of its nemesis so long as the two are on the same plane of existence, and it has advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

trait.name: Relentless Flesh
entries: The avenger regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the avenger takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The avenger’s body is destroyed and crumbles to ash only if it drops to 0 hit points and fails to regenerate on two consecutive turns.

trait.name: Single-Minded
entries: Effects that would turn undead have no effect on the avenger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avenger makes two {@action Graveborn Slam} attacks.

action.name: Graveborn Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+4} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.

action.name: Vengeful Glare {@recharge 5}
entries: The avenger fixes its burning gaze on one creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the avenger’s next turn. If the target is the avenger’s nemesis, it has disadvantage on the save.

bonus.name: Unerring Step
entries: The avenger moves up to its speed toward its nemesis without provoking opportunity attacks.

A Restless Avenger clawed its way back from death for a single purpose: to balance the scales. Until its nemesis lies cold and silent, the avenger endures arrow, flame, and prayer alike—the empty spark in its eyes fanned bright by vengeance unmet.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The rotgrub can burrow through solid earth and stone at half its burrow speed, leaving a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Wall Crawler
entries: The rotgrub can climb difficult surfaces, including upside-down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rotgrub makes two attacks: one with its {@action Toxic Feelers} and one with its {@action Gnawing Mandibles}.

action.name: Toxic Feelers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 1d8+3} poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} and {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending both conditions on itself on a success.

action.name: Gnawing Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 2d8+3} piercing damage.

action.name: Rotting Mucus {@recharge 5}
entries: The rotgrub spits corrosive slime in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Terrain in the cone becomes difficult terrain until cleared (clearing a 5-foot square takes 1 minute of work).

Rotgrub Tunnelers burrow through graveyards, sewers, and forgotten catacombs, their cadaver-fed colonies carving mazes of glistening slime. Adventurers who follow footprints into such tunnels seldom return—save as a trail of discarded gear and gnawed bones.

trait.name: Briny Transparency
entries: While fully submerged, the sprite is {@condition invisible} to creatures that rely on sight unless they succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check.

trait.name: Bound Waters
entries: The sprite must remain within 30 feet of the natural salt-water pool, tidal cave, or fountain that birthed it. If forced beyond this distance, it takes {@damage 4d6} force damage at the end of each of its turns until it returns to its bound waters or is destroyed.

trait.name: Fluid Form
entries: The sprite can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there; it can move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

action.name: Tidal Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 2d8+3} bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the sprite can’t lash another creature, and at the start of each of the sprite’s turns the target takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Surging Pull {@recharge 5}
entries: The sprite creates a burst of suction in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the sprite and knocked {@condition prone} when it enters the sprite’s space.

reaction.name: Water Warp
entries: When the sprite is hit by a ranged weapon attack, it halves the attack’s damage against it.

Sea Sprites coalesce where surf churns inside moonlit grottoes, guarding tide-pools adored by merfolk and pearl-divers alike. They are patient but possessive; those who honor ancient offerings of polished shells may pass unscathed, while the greedy vanish beneath a sudden, swirling wave.

trait.name: Shadowglide
entries: While the panther is in dim light or darkness, attack rolls against it have disadvantage, and it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This effect ends at the start of the panther’s next turn whenever it takes radiant damage or is hit by an attack.

trait.name: Umbral Step
entries: Opportunity attacks against the panther are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The panther makes two attacks: one with its {@action Claw} and one with its {@action Shadow Lash}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+4} slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Lash
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4+4} psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Fade Through Gloom {@recharge 5}
entries: The panther teleports up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness.

Shadowglide Panthers slip between pools of darkness like ripples across water, hunting by echo and silhouette. Those who track them find only paw-prints that begin, impossibly, in the middle of their own shadow.

trait.name: Lucid Authority
entries: The enforcer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and cannot be put to sleep.

trait.name: Mindlink Orders
entries: The enforcer can communicate telepathically with any allied enforcer within 60 feet.

trait.name: Mnemonic Discipline
entries: The enforcer cannot have its memories altered or erased against its will.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The enforcer makes two {@action Mnemonic Baton} attacks.

action.name: Mnemonic Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+3} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. If the target is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, it takes an additional {@damage 1d8} psychic damage.

action.name: Binding Mantra {@recharge 5}
entries: The enforcer utters a fragment of paradox. One creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: If at least one other enforcer is within 10 feet, the enforcer can move up to half its speed and make one {@action Mnemonic Baton} attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the enforcer’s next turn.

reaction.name: Psychic Riposte
entries: When the enforcer is hit by a melee attack, it can deal {@damage 1d10} psychic damage to the attacker.

Somniarchate Enforcers serve the Drowsekeep as memory arbiters and fugitive-catchers. They march in lockstep, speaking edicts in code only their minds can hear, and subdue dream-thieves with blows that echo through the mind as much as the body.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes {@damage 1d10} force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The wraith can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

action.name: Life-Draining Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 3d6+5} necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit-point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit-point maximum to 0.

action.name: Soulrend Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The wraith emits an otherworldly shriek audible within 60 feet. Each living creature that can hear it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails by 5 or more is also {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Soulshriek Wraiths are formed from spirits whose dying thoughts were so loud they tore a hole between life and death. Their laments scour flesh and memory alike, leaving nothing but silence—and the faintest taste of someone else’s sorrow—lingering on the wind.

monster.name: Sporebound Shepherd
languages: Understands Common and Sylvan but speaks only via Spore Link

trait.name: Damp-Rot Fortitude
entries: The shepherd has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Spore Link
entries: While within 30 feet of one or more other Sporebound (or naturally occurring fungi), the shepherd can communicate telepathically with them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shepherd makes two {@action Clublike Limb} attacks.

action.name: Clublike Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+2} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pacifying Cloud (1/Day)
entries: The shepherd exhales spores in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the shepherd for 1 minute. A charmed creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Hallucinogenic Puff {@recharge 5}
entries: The shepherd releases a 15-foot cone of vivid spores. Each creature in that cone must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn; on a success, it takes half damage and isn’t blinded.

bonus.name: Stimulate Growth (3/Day)
entries: One allied creature of the shepherd’s choice within 10 ft. gains 5 temporary hit points as tiny motes of regenerative fungus knit its wounds.

Sporebound Shepherds guide colonies of wandering fungi, coaxing sprouts from rot and steering them away from scorch-bright sunlight. Peaceful by nature, they answer intrusion first with calming spores—then with bewildering hallucinations if their pleas for silence go unheard.

trait.name: Celestial Resilience
entries: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Luminous Heart
entries: The scion emits bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for another 30 feet. While the scion is conscious, magical darkness can’t extinguish this light.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The scion’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scion makes two {@action Cosmic Hammer} attacks.

action.name: Cosmic Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d8+8} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 4d8} radiant damage.

action.name: Stellar Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 300 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 5d10+6} radiant damage.

action.name: Nova Pulse {@recharge 5}
entries: The scion releases a wave of searing light. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 12d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
{@bold Move.} The scion moves up to half its speed.
{@bold Stellar Bolt.} The scion makes one {@action Stellar Bolt} attack.

{@bold Radiant Reprisal (Costs 2 Actions).} The scion targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d8} radiant damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of the scion’s next turn.

Star-forged Scions are born when a benevolent deity tempers the last beat of a super-nova into living will. Tower-sized and ageless, they stride planar frontiers to mend rifts, guide lost caravans of souls, or smite blights upon reality with the force of newborn suns.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks taken while motionless

trait.name: Calcite Camouflage
entries: While motionless and attached to a cave ceiling, the skewer is indistinguishable from a natural stalactite. A creature can detect it with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check.

trait.name: Gravity Hunter
entries: If the skewer moves at least 20 feet straight downward toward a target and then hits it with a {@action Drop Impact} on the same turn, the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Drop Impact
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target directly beneath the skewer. {@h} {@damage 1d10+2} piercing damage. On a hit, the skewer lands prone in the target’s space.

action.name: Gouging Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. {@h} {@damage 2d6+2} slashing damage.

bonus.name: Ceiling Creep
entries: If the skewer hasn’t moved this turn and is within 5 feet of a ceiling, it climbs up and attaches itself there.

trait.name: Stormbound Form
entries: The ancestor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other effects that deal lightning or thunder damage.

trait.name: Nimbus of Tempests
entries: Stirring winds and needle-sharp rain fill a 30-foot radius around the ancestor. Ranged weapon attacks that pass through the aura are made with disadvantage. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 3d6} thunder damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ancestor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ancestor’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancestor makes two {@action Storm Glaive} attacks.

action.name: Storm Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d12+9} slashing damage plus {@damage 4d8} lightning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 240 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d10+10} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thundercrash {@recharge 5}
entries: The ancestor slams the ground, releasing concussive force in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is also knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Living Tempest {@recharge 4}
entries: Storm winds bear the ancestor aloft. Until the start of its next turn it gains a flying speed of 60 ft. and can hover; opportunity attacks against it are made with disadvantage during this flight.
{@bold Gust.} The ancestor moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
{@bold Glaive.} The ancestor makes one {@action Storm Glaive} attack.

{@bold Lightning Burst (Costs 2 Actions).} The ancestor targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

Tempest Ancestors remember the first thunderclaps that rolled across the newborn world. Their hearts beat to the rhythm of crashing waves, and their voices carry the promise of monsoon. To rouse them is to gamble one’s city against the mood of the sky.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sovereign can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Abyssal Glide
entries: Difficult terrain composed of water or mud costs the sovereign no extra movement, and it can enter another creature’s space (treating it as difficult terrain) while swimming.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sovereign’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sovereign makes two attacks: one with its {@action Trident of Tides} and one with its {@action Tidal Slam}.

action.name: Trident of Tides
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d8+8} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d8} cold damage.

action.name: Tidal Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+8} bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 ft. in a straight line.

action.name: Roaring Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The sovereign exhales a crushing surge of water in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is also {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} by swirling currents until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Wall of Foam
entries: When a creature the sovereign can see targets it with an attack, the sovereign conjures frothing water, granting itself +3 AC against that attack.

Tide-Djinn Sovereigns sway entire currents with a gesture and broker pacts in coral-lit courts miles beneath the surface. Sailors who earn their favor receive calm seas and silvered fish; those who offend them vanish beneath storm-wrought swells, never to rise again.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tideborne can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Current Glide
entries: While swimming, the tideborne’s speed is not reduced by difficult terrain created by water movement (such as strong currents).

action.name: Coral-Tip Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+1} piercing damage.

action.name: Net Toss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 10/30 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h} The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Destroying the net (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to slashing damage) also frees the creature.

Tideborne Folk farm kelp terraces, carve coral homes, and trade polished shell-baubles for surface iron. Though wary of landwalkers, they will guide respectful travelers through whirl-riddled channels—and drown those who foul the sea with greed or gore.

trait.name: Watch Aspect
entries: When the guardian finishes a long rest, it adopts one aspect—Radiant, Gloaming, or Somber—granting the listed resistance and modifying its {@action Watchstep} bonus action. The guardian can change its aspect only by completing another long rest.

entries.caption: Watch Aspect Effects
rows: Up to two allies within 10 ft. of the destination each regain 10 hit points and shed dim light in a 10-ft. radius until the start of the guardian’s next turn.
One creature of the guardian’s choice within 10 ft. of the destination must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom save or become {@condition charmed} for 1 minute (repeat save at end of each of its turns).
Each enemy within 10 ft. of the destination must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom save or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Fey Footwork
entries: Opportunity attacks against the guardian are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian makes two attacks with either its {@action Longsword} or {@action Longbow}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+7} slashing damage, or {@damage 1d10+7} slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+7} piercing damage.

bonus.name: Watchstep {@recharge 4}
entries: The guardian teleports up to 30 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see, then immediately applies its Aspect’s {@action Watchstep} Effect.

reaction.name: Sylvan Riposte
entries: When a creature the guardian can see misses it with a melee attack, the guardian makes one {@action Longsword} attack against that creature.

Triwatch Guardians patrol the Dreamtide’s shifting hours, ensuring Radiant order, Gloaming balance, and Somber repose are each observed in turn. Their blades cut with the resolve of sunrise, dusk, or moonlit hush—whichever watch currently holds sway.

monster.name: Umbral Colossus
languages: Understands Common and Abyssal but can’t speak

trait.name: Light-Eclipsing Aura
entries: Nonmagical light within 30 feet of the colossus is suppressed to dim light. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage, and its hit-point maximum is reduced by the same amount. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. A creature that dies while its maximum is reduced by this aura rises 1 minute later as a {@creature shadow} under the colossus’s control.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The colossus makes two {@action Crushing Fist} attacks.

action.name: Crushing Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d10+6} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage.

action.name: Void Sweep {@recharge 5}
entries: The colossus sweeps an arm of devouring shadow in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
{@bold Shadow Step.} The colossus moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
{@bold Fist.} The colossus makes one {@action Crushing Fist} attack.

{@bold Umbral Pulse (Costs 2 Actions).} The colossus emits a surge of darkness. Creatures of the colossus’s choice within 20 feet must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

Umbral Colossi are forged where great shadows coagulate—abandoned battlefields beneath eclipsed skies, or necrotic scars at the heart of long-dead stars. Each one is a walking absence, hungry for anything that still draws breath and dares to shine.

trait.name: Serpentine Guile
entries: The deceiver has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to pass itself off as a non-serpentine humanoid.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deceiver has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The deceiver’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deceiver makes two attacks: one with its {@action Serpent-Blade} and one with its {@action Venomous Bite}.

action.name: Serpent-Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6+3} slashing damage.

action.name: Venomous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 1d6+3} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d6} poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Charming Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The deceiver targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature is also {@condition incapacitated} and its speed is 0. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Vipersoul Deceivers insinuate themselves into courts and caravans alike, hiding forked tongues behind honeyed words. A single glance from their ophidian eyes can still the will of even steel-nerved sentinels, leaving them helpless while the cult’s coils close in.

trait.name: Iron Will
entries: The juggernaut has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The juggernaut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries: The juggernaut’s spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The juggernaut makes three attacks: two with its {@action Serpent-Blade} and one with its {@action Venomous Bite}, or two with its {@action Serpent-Blade} and one with its {@action Tail Smash}.

action.name: Serpent-Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6+4} slashing damage.

action.name: Venomous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 2d6+4} piercing damage plus {@damage 3d6} poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 2d8+4} bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Uncoiled Dash {@recharge 4}
entries: The juggernaut moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Coiling Parry
entries: When a creature the juggernaut can see hits it with a melee attack, the juggernaut adds +3 to its AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

Vipersoul Juggernauts rule hidden serpent cults with equal parts guile and brute force. In battle they glide forward on rippling coils, blades flashing and fangs dripping toxin potent enough to stop a giant’s heart.

monster.name: Void-Maw Goliath
languages: Understands Deep Speech but can’t speak

trait.name: Cosmic Carapace
entries: The goliath has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against it.

trait.name: Gravity Well Aura
entries: Creatures of the goliath’s choice that start their turn within 30 feet have their speed halved until the start of their next turn, and ranged weapon attacks that pass through the aura are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Void Maw
entries: A portal to raw nothingness yawns within the goliath’s jaws. A Large or smaller creature grappled by the goliath (escape {@dc 20}) is also {@condition restrained} and takes {@damage 6d6} force damage at the start of each of the goliath’s turns while grappled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goliath makes one {@action Bite} and one {@action Crushing Claw} attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 4d10+8} piercing damage plus {@damage 3d8} force damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the goliath can’t bite another target.

action.name: Crushing Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 3d8+10} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Warping Pulse {@recharge 5}
entries: The goliath releases a blast of compressing gravity in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. On a failed save, a creature is also {@condition prone}.
{@bold Detect.} The goliath makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.
{@bold Claw.} The goliath makes one {@action Crushing Claw} attack.

{@bold Void Surge (Costs 2 Actions).} The goliath’s Gravity Well Aura intensifies until the end of its next turn. During that time, the radius extends to 60 feet and any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet straight toward the goliath.

Void-Maw Goliaths drift between worlds on unseen tidal forces, devouring derelict spelljammers, newborn stars, and anything else unfortunate enough to cross their path. Those who gaze into the abyss behind their teeth glimpse infinity—and are rarely heard from again.

trait.name: Fey-Touched Resilience
entries: The warlock has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Beguiling Veil
entries: While the warlock is in dim light or darkness, attack rolls against it are made with disadvantage unless the attacker can see through illusions.

spellcasting.name: Pact Magic
headerEntries: The warlock is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It regains expended slots on a short or long rest.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d4+2} piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 1d10+4} force damage.

action.name: Fey Maw Manifest {@recharge 5}
entries: The warlock exhales an illusion of a grinning void in a 15-ft. cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom save. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d8} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn; on a success, it takes half damage and isn’t frightened.

bonus.name: Maw’s Lure {@recharge 4}
entries: The warlock targets one creature within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma save or be {@condition charmed} until the start of the warlock’s next turn. While charmed, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and its speed is 0.

reaction.name: Veil Flicker
entries: When a ranged attack would hit the warlock, it can roll 1d6; on a 4 or higher, the attack instead targets a random creature within 5 ft. (including the attacker if no other target is available).
Those who bargain with the Smiling Maw gain the power to twist minds with a grin. Their witch-lights lure wanderers off moonlit paths; their whispers promise ecstasy, yet taste faintly of oblivion.

monster.name: Warplate Revenant

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren’t adamantine

languages: Understands the languages of its long-dead bearer but can’t speak

trait.name: Arcane Ward
entries: The revenant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spell Negation
entries: The revenant is immune to the effects of {@spell heat metal}, {@spell lightning bolt}, and {@spell magic missile}.

trait.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: The revenant doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two {@action Adamant Slash} attacks.

action.name: Adamant Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8+6} slashing damage, or {@damage 1d10+6} slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

reaction.name: Spell-Cleaving Parry
entries: When a creature the revenant can see targets it with a spell attack, the revenant adds +3 to its AC against that attack. If the attack misses, the caster takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.

A Warplate Revenant is forged when a hero’s spirit fuses to their armor through violent sorcery or sheer will. Its empty helm glows ember-red, and its sword swings as if still guided by the warrior’s unbroken resolve—cutting down any who would disturb the field where its charge once fell.
